list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor payment template rendering for improved structure
Modified `li_payements.html` to render individual payment cards inside the loop instead of using a table structure. This enhances readability, maintainability, and aligns the UI with modern styling practices. Simplified template logic, improving clarity and reducing redundant code.

component.name: DjangoConsoleOptions

option.name: myCustomStartScript

task.summary:
Remove unused files and update configuration.
Deleted unnecessary media files, initial migration script, and outdated IDE configuration files. Updated database settings with a password and made minor formatting improvements in models.py. These changes enhance project cleanup and improve maintainability.

Delete outdated data source files and update image paths.
Removed obsolete database data source files to clean up the project. Updated the structure by renaming `assest_globe` image files and moving them to the `mapping` directory for better organization. These changes improve project maintainability and clarify file usage.

Update collation mappings in data source configuration
Revised collation names and default charset settings in the XML to reflect updated configurations. Adjustments ensure accurate collation name usage and proper charset defaults for various encodings.

Add payment feature with templates and dynamic updates
Implemented functionalities for managing payments, including views, templates, scripts, and styles. Updated navigation for new payment routes and integrated the feature with existing client and merchandise data.

Add new models and configs for migrations and images
Introduced `Marchandise` and `Paiement` models via a new Django migration file to support additional functionalities. Added new image files and an XML configuration likely for IDE data sources. These changes prepare the project for further feature expansion and collaboration setup.

Remove unused styles and refine payment list template.
Eliminated redundant inline styles and adjusted the loop rendering for `marchandises` to access `nom`. These changes improve template clarity, maintainability, and adherence to best practices.

Update payment handling and navigation links
Replaced `textContent` with `innerText` for compatibility and updated hidden input management in payment scripts. Adjusted templates to dynamically link navigation to Django's URL resolver, improving maintainability. Introduced a new payment list template with enhanced styles for better user experience.

Refactor payment templates to use a base structure.
Updated `li_payements.html` to extend a new `base_liste_paiements.html` template for better reusability and maintainability. Integrated Bootstrap and external resources for enhanced styling and functionality, replacing outdated static assets.

Refactor payment template rendering for improved structure
Modified `li_payements.html` to render individual payment cards inside the loop instead of using a table structure. This enhances readability, maintainability, and aligns the UI with modern styling practices. Simplified template logic, improving clarity and reducing redundant code.

MESSAGE.value:
Remove unused files and update configuration.
Deleted unnecessary media files, initial migration script, and outdated IDE configuration files. Updated database settings with a password and made minor formatting improvements in models.py. These changes enhance project cleanup and improve maintainability.

Delete outdated data source files and update image paths.
Removed obsolete database data source files to clean up the project. Updated the structure by renaming `assest_globe` image files and moving them to the `mapping` directory for better organization. These changes improve project maintainability and clarify file usage.

Update collation mappings in data source configuration
Revised collation names and default charset settings in the XML to reflect updated configurations. Adjustments ensure accurate collation name usage and proper charset defaults for various encodings.

Add payment feature with templates and dynamic updates
Implemented functionalities for managing payments, including views, templates, scripts, and styles. Updated navigation for new payment routes and integrated the feature with existing client and merchandise data.

Add new models and configs for migrations and images
Introduced `Marchandise` and `Paiement` models via a new Django migration file to support additional functionalities. Added new image files and an XML configuration likely for IDE data sources. These changes prepare the project for further feature expansion and collaboration setup.

Remove unused styles and refine payment list template.
Eliminated redundant inline styles and adjusted the loop rendering for `marchandises` to access `nom`. These changes improve template clarity, maintainability, and adherence to best practices.

Update payment handling and navigation links
Replaced `textContent` with `innerText` for compatibility and updated hidden input management in payment scripts. Adjusted templates to dynamically link navigation to Django's URL resolver, improving maintainability. Introduced a new payment list template with enhanced styles for better user experience.

Refactor payment templates to use a base structure.
Updated `li_payements.html` to extend a new `base_liste_paiements.html` template for better reusability and maintainability. Integrated Bootstrap and external resources for enhanced styling and functionality, replacing outdated static assets.

Refactor payment template rendering for improved structure
Modified `li_payements.html` to render individual payment cards inside the loop instead of using a table structure. This enhances readability, maintainability, and aligns the UI with modern styling practices. Simplified template logic, improving clarity and reducing redundant code.
